summary: Sicily is the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea, located off the southern coast of Italy. With a population of 4.8 million, it is known for its rich history and culture. The island has been inhabited since around 14,000 BC and has seen many civilizations, including the Greeks, Romans, and Arabs. Mount Etna, an active volcano, is its most famous landmark. Sicily became part of unified Italy in 1860 and is now an autonomous region with its own unique traditions and language.
title: Sicily
